result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: CASES: 17CF386, 18CF134, 16CM170.  10:02 AM Defendant Kevin J. Hicks in court with attorney Mark Drew Biller.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  RL-clerk.  File 16CM170 which is a Judge Waterman case is also being addressed in resolution per counsel. ADA to file amended information.  On 17CF386- amended count 1 w/out repeater- def- G plea.  CT accepts plea, adj G.  CT orders PSI long form, agent does not need to be present unless counsel subpoenas agent for hearing.   18CF134 read in and dismissed on state's motion. Count 2 17CF386 RI&D on state's motion.  16CM170 read in for restitution and dismissed on state's motion.   Bond posted in 18CF134 to be transferred to file 17CF386.  CT sets new bond.  Atty Biller- counsel stipulates to waive any prev substitution or any other conflict on 16CM170 file for dismissal purposes as part of global resolution.  CT reviews discussion with Judge Waterman's assistant on his case and the request for not rescheduling that case on his calendar for today as long as the file is dismissed as part of the resolution.  CT finds waiver of any potential disqualification on that file is made FK&V.  CT- 16CM170 is dismissed on state's motion after confirmation that Judge Waterman was aware of the resolution for dismissal of the file.  Restitution from 16CM170 will be added and addressed in sentencing for 17CF386.   10:43 am adj.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 17, 2019 at 11:00 am.
